page.title: 07HEALTH
page.content: The hospital in Halstead is a little way along Hedingham Road. It was built in 1884 by{George Courtauld}to commemerate the death of his late wife An extention was added in 1920 as a memorial to George Courtauld who owned the mill. The hospital was built for the local people but is mostly used for elderly people now. The funds raised by the local people are used for the upkeep of equipment as well as improving the facilities. Without this support it is probable that the hospital would have been closed long ago. There are wonderful views of the Colne Valley from the windows. The land on the opposite side was also given by George Courtauld so that no building could spoil the view of the residents. The land is now planted by Halstaed and District Horticural and Chrysanthemum Society.
